Config
FontSize
Int Property FontSize = 20 Auto Hidden

Default font size

Used in HTML mode only

TextColorDefault
String Property TextColorDefault = "#FFFFFF" Auto Hidden

Default text color

Used in HTML mode only

LinesOnPage
Int Property LinesOnPage = 12 Auto Hidden

The number of lines on one page. If there are more, the text will be divided into several page

Used in Legacy mode only

LinesOnHTMLPage
Int Property LinesOnHTMLPage = 16 Auto Hidden

The number of lines on one page. If there are more, the text will be divided into several page

Used in HTML mode only

CharsOnPage
Int Property CharsOnPage = 1900 Auto Hidden

Maximum number of characters per page. If there are more, the text will be divided into several page

Used in all modes

CharsCTD
Int Property CharsCTD = 2047 Auto Hidden

A hard limit on the number of characters in a single window.  If there are more characters than this, the text will be skipped to avoid CTD

Used in all modes

Mode Control
GetModes
String[] Function GetModes()

The function returns all possible modes of the formatter as an array of strings

Returns

Array of strings with possible modes

SetMode
Function SetMode(
String abMode
)

The function sets new operation mode for the formatter

Parameters
abMode
String

New operation mode

GetMode
String Function GetMode()

The function returns current operation mode of the formatter

Returns

Operation mode

GetModeIndex
Int Function GetModeIndex()

The function returns index of the current operation mode

Returns

Operation mode index

HasHtmlMarkup
Bool Function HasHtmlMarkup()

Returns true if the formatted text contains HTML markup

Returns

True for HTML

Text Formatting
Header
String Function Header(
String asHeader,
Int aiFontSize = -1
)

Returns formatted header

Parameters
asHeader
String

Header content

aiFontSize
Int

Font size. If -1 then it doesn't change

Returns

String with the text fragment

TableBegin
String Function TableBegin(
Int aiLeftMargin,
Int aiColumn1Width,
Int aiColumn2Width = 0,
Int aiColumn3Width = 0,
Int aiColumn4Width = 0,
Int aiLeading = -2
)

Returns the beginning of the table customized by the specified parameters

Parameters
aiLeftMargin
Int

Indentation on the left. Not always respected, because the automatic window width calculation in SWF does not always handle our improvised tables correctly.

aiColumn1Width
Int

Width of the first column

aiColumn2Width
Int

Width of the second column

aiColumn3Width
Int

Width of the third column

aiColumn4Width
Int

Width of the fourth column

aiLeading
Int

Spacing between lines

Returns

String with the text fragment

TableEnd
String Function TableEnd()

Returns closing table tags

Returns

String with the text fragment

FontBegin
String Function FontBegin(
Int aiFontSize = -1,
String asFontFace = "",
String asColor = ""
)

Opening tag for the text with customized font

Parameters
aiFontSize
Int

Font size. If no value is specified, the size does not change.

asFontFace
String

Font name. If no value is specified, the font face does not change.

asColor
String

Color hex code. If no value is specified, the font color does not change.

Returns

String with the text fragment

FontEnd
String Function FontEnd()

Returns closing font tag

Returns

String with the text fragment

ParagraphBegin
String Function ParagraphBegin(
String asAlign = "",
Int aiLeading = -99
)

Opening tag for the text in customized paragraph

Parameters
asAlign
String

Horizontal text alignment (left, center, right). If no value is specified, the alignment does not change.

aiLeading
Int

Spacing between lines. If no value is specified, the spacing does not change.

Returns

String with the text fragment

ParagraphEnd
String Function ParagraphEnd()

Returns closing paragraph tag. It has a line break at the end!

Returns

String with the text fragment

Paragraph
String Function Paragraph(
String asText,
Int aiFontSize = -1,
String asFontFace = "",
String asColor = "",
String asAlign = "",
Int aiLeading = -99
)

Returns text decorated with specified modifiers as a separate paragraph (with line break at the end)

Parameters
asText
String

Text to print.

aiFontSize
Int

Font size. If no value is specified, the size does not change.

asFontFace
String

Font name. If no value is specified, the font face does not change.

asColor
String

Color hex code. If no value is specified, the font color does not change.

asAlign
String

Horizontal text alignment (left, center, right). If no value is specified, the alignment does not change.

aiLeading
Int

Spacing between lines. If no value is specified, the spacing does not change.

Returns

String with the text fragment

String Function TableRowDetails(
String asLeft,
String asRight,
String asColor = ""
)

Parameters
asLeft
String

Text in the first (left) column.

asRight
String

Text in the second (right) column.

asColor
String

Color of the text in the second column. If no value is specified, the font color does not change.

Returns

Returns

String with the text fragment

PageSplit
String Function PageSplit(
Bool abForce = True
)

Returns a page break

Parameters
abForce
Bool

If true, the page break will be used when rendering message.  Otherwise, the it will be used only if necessary.

Returns

String with the text fragment

HeaderSplit
String Function HeaderSplit()

Marking the boundary of the message header. The header will be repeated on each page of the message when displayed on multiple pages

Returns

String with the text fragment

FooterSplit
String Function FooterSplit()

Marking the boundary of the message footer. The footer will be repeated on each page of the message when displayed on multiple pages

Returns

String with the text fragment

AddTag
String Function AddTag(
String asTag,
String asInner = ""
)

Helper function for wrapping text in an arbitrary tag

Returns

String with the text fragment

SplitMessageIntoPages
String[] Function SplitMessageIntoPages(
String asMessage,
Int aiLines = -1
)

Function for dividing long message text into pages. This is also where you clean up the text, substitute replacements, add a header and footer

Parameters
asMessage
String

Message text

aiLines
Int

Number of lines per page. If no value is specified, the default value used (see LinesOnPage and LinesOnHTMLPage)

Returns

String array with pages

Int aiPageCurrent,
Int aiPageTotal
)

Adds a footer with page number

Parameters
aiPageCurrent
Int

Current page number

aiPageTotal
Int

Total number of pages

Returns

String with the text fragment

String Function ForceCase(
String asString,
Bool abUpperCase = True
)

An attempt to overcome string caching inside Papyrus and fix all characters in one case

Parameters
asString
String

Given string

abUpperCase
Bool

Character case to use

Returns

Helpers
PercentToGrayscale
String Function PercentToGrayscale(
Int aiPercent
)

Turns the percentage into a color code on the gray scale.  0 corresponds to dark gray color 100 corresponds to white color

Parameters
aiPercent
Int

Percent value

Returns

Hexadecimal color code in CSS format with leading '#'

PercentToRainbow
String Function PercentToRainbow(
Int aiPercent
)

Turns the percentage into a color code on a "rainbow".  0 corresponds to purple color 50 corresponds to yellow color 100 corresponds to green color

Parameters
aiPercent
Int

Percent value

Returns

Hexadecimal color code in CSS format with leading '#'

BoolToGrayscale
String Function BoolToGrayscale(
Bool abValue
)

Turns the boolean into a color code on the gray scale.  False corresponds to dark gray color True corresponds to white color

Parameters
abValue
Bool

Boolean value

Returns

Hexadecimal color code in CSS format with leading '#'

BoolToRainbow
String Function BoolToRainbow(
Bool abValue
)

Turns the boolean into a color code on the 'rainbow'.  False corresponds to magenta True corresponds to green

Parameters
abValue
Bool

Boolean value

Returns

Hexadecimal color code in CSS format with leading '#'

RemoveDuplicates
String Function RemoveDuplicates(
String asStr,
String asSubstr
)

Deletes consecutive substrings

Parameters
asStr
String

Given string

asFind

Substring to find and remove duplicates

Returns

The resulting string

RemoveDuplicates

Returns one of its arguments depending on the condition.  The main disadvantage of the function is that it is calculated in advance for all branches, regardless of the condition.  Use with caution

Parameters
abCondition

Condition

asTrue

String for True condition

asFalse

String for False condition

Returns

The resulting string
